news.title: Dues not paid under rehab policy, Greater Noida authority to crack down on builders
news.para: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority is withdrawing benefits from defaulting builders to revive stalled projects, having recovered Rs 1,382 crore. The authority has hired Currie and Brown for physical assessments of projects, categorizing them based on payment status and legal standing to determine the next course of action.

news.title: About 7,000 returnable plots in Amaravati yet to be registered: Andhra Pradesh municipal minister
news.para: Ongoing efforts are being made to register returnable plots for farmers in Amaravati, with Minister P Narayana revealing that 7,000 plots have not yet been registered. However, the government is committed to facilitating these registrations and promises to have infrastructure in place within two years.

news.title: Hong Kong's Lai Sun Development sells stake in central office tower for $450 million
news.para: Lai Sun Development is parting ways with its share of an office tower in Hong Kong, listing it for HK$3.5 billion. This decisive action is intended to enhance the company's cash reserves during a period of significant financial strains, marked by plummeting property sales and limited access to financing.

news.title: Construction equipment rental firm EquipmentShare files for US IPO
news.para: Amidst a wave of companies eager to make their public debut, EquipmentShare.com has announced a notable rise in revenue as part of its initial public offering filing in the US. This signal of growth comes as firms gear up for year-end listings.

news.title: Wakefit's ₹1,289-crore IPO received 39% subscription on day 2
news.para: The Wakefit Innovations IPO has entered its second day with a noteworthy 39 percent subscription rate. This Rs 1,289 crore public offering, still open for bids, has seen retail investors express considerable interest, subscribing 1.77 times their share quota. However, institutional investors have yet to commit extensively.

news.title: Assembly clears bill easing land subdivision rules in Maharashtra; move to benefit three crore residents
news.para: The Maharashtra Assembly has taken a major step forward by passing a new bill that facilitates the subdivision of small land plots in urban settings. This change is poised to assist around 30 million residents who inhabit 'gunthewari' plots.

news.title: Assam CM  hands over sanction letters to over 3.25 beneficiaries under PMAY-G
news.para: Assam's chief minister launched sanction letters for over 3.25 lakh beneficiaries under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Gramin. Previous distributions have already helped lakhs of families. Geo-tagging is complete, and new lists will be prepared.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: Dhauli Heights allotment process enters final stage after decade-long wait
news.para: Cooperation minister Pradeep Bal Samanta announced that the Dhauli Heights housing project's allotment is nearing completion after nearly a decade of delays. The project, stalled by contractor issues and funding problems, is awaiting an occupancy certificate from the BDA, with a handover expected within a month.

news.title: Chinese officials call for more REITs to steady property sector
news.para: China's securities regulator is pushing for a swift expansion of its public real estate investment trust market. This move aims to help property developers facing liquidity issues and cater to investors seeking returns. Commercial properties like hotels and offices could soon be listed as REITs. This initiative is expected to ease developer debt burdens and stabilize the property market.

news.title: Delhi CM vows to redevelop Bhalswa-Jahangirpuri EWS flats into model settlement
news.para: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta visited the run-down EWS flats in Bhalswa-Jahangirpuri. She announced a plan to remodel the flats into a model settlement. This redevelopment will include shops, parking, charging stations, a school, and community facilities.

news.title: Karnataka HC upholds premium FAR policy; dismisses petitions filed by TDR holders
news.para: The Karnataka High Court has upheld the State's introduction of Premium Floor Area Ratio. This ruling validates the government's ability to collect charges for additional buildable rights. Landowners who received Transferable Development Rights previously challenged the policy. The court found Premium FAR and TDR to be complementary mechanisms.

news.title: Surat: Dumas Seaface's developer penalised over inadequate measures to control dust pollution
news.para: A construction agency faced a Rs 5 lakh penalty for failing to control dust pollution at the Dumas Seaface project. Surat Municipal Corporation officials found inadequate dust suppression systems and waste management. This is part of a city-wide crackdown on construction sites. Over 180 sites have been fined for violations like missing shade nets and improper waste disposal.

news.title: Over 140 hotels & hostels in Nagpur play with fire, safety norms
news.para: Nagpur faces a significant fire safety crisis with 143 hotels and hostels flagged for serious lapses, many operating without mandatory No Objection Certificates. Over 75% of establishments seeking temporary approval remain non-compliant, and 43 buildings are officially declared unsafe, yet most continue to operate, endangering lives.

news.title: Trichy smart city projects that are not smart enough
news.para: Trichy's smart cities mission, launched seven years ago, has seen several projects fail. Poor planning and fund shortages led to unused markets, incomplete malls, and vacant commercial spaces. The corporation now struggles with the maintenance of numerous public parks. These initiatives, implemented without elected council input, are burdening the local body with unfulfilled expectations and financial strain.

news.title: Only 90 out of 1,000 hotels and clubs in Delhi have fire NOC
news.para: Delhi Fire Service data reveals a stark reality: out of nearly 1,000 hotels and clubs, only 90 possess fire safety no-objection certificates. This comes as the city's excise department previously urged establishments to ensure safety measures, highlighting a significant gap in compliance despite regulations.

news.title: Home loans up 14%, but buyer growth lags at 7% in Gujarat
news.para: Gujarat's housing loan disbursals rose 14% year-on-year, indicating robust credit flow. However, a slower 7% growth in borrowers and declining demand, especially in the affordable segment, suggest subdued purchase momentum. Rising property prices are causing mid-income and first-time buyers to delay purchases, impacting overall market activity.

news.title: Kochi apartment owners seek relaxation for installing STPs in old buildings
news.para: Apartment owners in Kerala are urging the Chief Minister to relax STP installation rules for buildings constructed before 2007, citing the upcoming centralized sewerage system. They fear losing occupancy certificates and essential services due to retrospective pollution control board notices. The consortium highlights the significant cost of individual STPs versus the planned city-wide network.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government begins regularisation of ‘Sada Bainama’ land agreements
news.para: Lakhs of farmers in Andhra Pradesh are set to receive land titles as the government moves to regularize decades-old 'Sada Bainama' agreements. This initiative, driven by Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu's directive, aims to provide legal ownership and security to cultivators who have worked land without formal documentation for years.

news.title: Karnataka RERA chairman urges citizens not to accept deficient service
news.para: The real estate regulator, the RERA chairman said, has revolutionized homebuyers' rights by empowering them to demand accountability from developers, and by mandating transparency, timely possession, refunds, defect-free properties, and complete documentation.
